title: Base R Programming
text:
Create pre- and post-treatment vectors for blood pressure for subjects 1 through 20

pre <- c(130, 128, 116, 124, 133, 134, 118, 126, 114, 127, 141, 138, 128, 140, 137, 131, 120, 128, 139, 135)
post <- c(114, 98, 113, 99, 107, 116, 113, 111, 119, 117, 101, 119, 130, 122, 106, 106, 124, 102, 117, 113)

Assign names to the vector elements

names(pre) <- paste("Subject", 1:20, sep = "_")
attributes(pre)

$names
 [1] "Subject_1"  "Subject_2"  "Subject_3"  "Subject_4"  "Subject_5" 
 [6] "Subject_6"  "Subject_7"  "Subject_8"  "Subject_9"  "Subject_10"
[11] "Subject_11" "Subject_12" "Subject_13" "Subject_14" "Subject_15"
[16] "Subject_16" "Subject_17" "Subject_18" "Subject_19" "Subject_20"

names(post) <- paste("Subject", 1:20, sep = "_")
attributes(post)

$names
 [1] "Subject_1"  "Subject_2"  "Subject_3"  "Subject_4"  "Subject_5" 
 [6] "Subject_6"  "Subject_7"  "Subject_8"  "Subject_9"  "Subject_10"
[11] "Subject_11" "Subject_12" "Subject_13" "Subject_14" "Subject_15"
[16] "Subject_16" "Subject_17" "Subject_18" "Subject_19" "Subject_20"


Calculate pre to post change and store results in a new vector

change <- pre - post
change

 Subject_1  Subject_2  Subject_3  Subject_4  Subject_5  Subject_6  Subject_7 
        16         30          3         25         26         18          5 
 Subject_8  Subject_9 Subject_10 Subject_11 Subject_12 Subject_13 Subject_14 
        15         -5         10         40         19         -2         18 
Subject_15 Subject_16 Subject_17 Subject_18 Subject_19 Subject_20 
        31         25         -4         26         22         22 


Calculate the mean change in blood pressure across participants

mean(change)

[1] 17


Use which() function to determine which patients experience a decrease in blood pressure (i.e., positive change)

which(change > 0)

 Subject_1  Subject_2  Subject_3  Subject_4  Subject_5  Subject_6  Subject_7 
         1          2          3          4          5          6          7 
 Subject_8 Subject_10 Subject_11 Subject_12 Subject_14 Subject_15 Subject_16 
         8         10         11         12         14         15         16 
Subject_18 Subject_19 Subject_20 
        18         19         20 


Subset the vector of differences to only return those that have a positive change

change[which(change>0)]

 Subject_1  Subject_2  Subject_3  Subject_4  Subject_5  Subject_6  Subject_7 
        16         30          3         25         26         18          5 
 Subject_8 Subject_10 Subject_11 Subject_12 Subject_14 Subject_15 Subject_16 
        15         10         40         19         18         31         25 
Subject_18 Subject_19 Subject_20 
        26         22         22 


Calculate average decrease in blood pressure for those with a positive change

mean(change[which(change>0)])

[1] 20.64706

title: Base R Programming
text:
Create pre- and post-treatment vectors for blood pressure for subjects 1 through 20

pre <- c(130, 128, 116, 124, 133, 134, 118, 126, 114, 127, 141, 138, 128, 140, 137, 131, 120, 128, 139, 135)
post <- c(114, 98, 113, 99, 107, 116, 113, 111, 119, 117, 101, 119, 130, 122, 106, 106, 124, 102, 117, 113)

title: Base R Programming
text:
Task 2: Basic Data Frame Practice
Create a data frame object with four columns corresponding to data above (replacing row names with integers to avoid redundancy)

bp_df<-data.frame(patient = names(pre), pre_bp = pre, 
                  post_bp = post, diff_bp = change, row.names=seq(1:20))
bp_df

      patient pre_bp post_bp diff_bp
1   Subject_1    130     114      16
2   Subject_2    128      98      30
3   Subject_3    116     113       3
4   Subject_4    124      99      25
5   Subject_5    133     107      26
6   Subject_6    134     116      18
7   Subject_7    118     113       5
8   Subject_8    126     111      15
9   Subject_9    114     119      -5
10 Subject_10    127     117      10
11 Subject_11    141     101      40
12 Subject_12    138     119      19
13 Subject_13    128     130      -2
14 Subject_14    140     122      18
15 Subject_15    137     106      31
16 Subject_16    131     106      25
17 Subject_17    120     124      -4
18 Subject_18    128     102      26
19 Subject_19    139     117      22
20 Subject_20    135     113      22


Return only rows where diff_bp is negative

bp_df[bp_df$diff_bp < 0, ]

      patient pre_bp post_bp diff_bp
9   Subject_9    114     119      -5
13 Subject_13    128     130      -2
17 Subject_17    120     124      -4


Add a column corresponding to TRUE if post_bp is less than 120

bp_df$post_120 <- ifelse(bp_df$post_bp < 120, TRUE, FALSE)
bp_df

      patient pre_bp post_bp diff_bp post_120
1   Subject_1    130     114      16     TRUE
2   Subject_2    128      98      30     TRUE
3   Subject_3    116     113       3     TRUE
4   Subject_4    124      99      25     TRUE
5   Subject_5    133     107      26     TRUE
6   Subject_6    134     116      18     TRUE
7   Subject_7    118     113       5     TRUE
8   Subject_8    126     111      15     TRUE
9   Subject_9    114     119      -5     TRUE
10 Subject_10    127     117      10     TRUE
11 Subject_11    141     101      40     TRUE
12 Subject_12    138     119      19     TRUE
13 Subject_13    128     130      -2    FALSE
14 Subject_14    140     122      18    FALSE
15 Subject_15    137     106      31     TRUE
16 Subject_16    131     106      25     TRUE
17 Subject_17    120     124      -4    FALSE
18 Subject_18    128     102      26     TRUE
19 Subject_19    139     117      22     TRUE
20 Subject_20    135     113      22     TRUE

title: Base R Programming
text:
Task 3: List Practice
Create a new data frame with placebo data that is similar to the data frame from task 2

#Starting with 3 core variables (Patient, pre_bp, and post_bp)
bp2_df <- data.frame(patient = paste("Subject", 1:10, sep="_"), 
                     pre_bp = c(138, 135, 147, 117, 152, 134,
                                114,121, 131, 130), 
                     post_bp = c(105, 136, 123, 130, 134, 143, 
                                 135, 139, 120, 124))
#Now generating last 2 variables from these
bp2_df$diff_bp <- bp2_df$pre_bp - bp2_df$post_bp
bp2_df$post_120 <- ifelse(bp2_df$post_bp < 120, TRUE, FALSE)
bp2_df

      patient pre_bp post_bp diff_bp post_120
1   Subject_1    138     105      33     TRUE
2   Subject_2    135     136      -1    FALSE
3   Subject_3    147     123      24    FALSE
4   Subject_4    117     130     -13    FALSE
5   Subject_5    152     134      18    FALSE
6   Subject_6    134     143      -9    FALSE
7   Subject_7    114     135     -21    FALSE
8   Subject_8    121     139     -18    FALSE
9   Subject_9    131     120      11    FALSE
10 Subject_10    130     124       6    FALSE


Create and store a list with 2 elements: 1st named treatment, 2nd named placebo

bp_list <- list(treatment = bp_df, placebo = bp2_df)
str(bp_list)

List of 2
 $ treatment:'data.frame':  20 obs. of  5 variables:
  ..$ patient : chr [1:20] "Subject_1" "Subject_2" "Subject_3" "Subject_4" ...
  ..$ pre_bp  : num [1:20] 130 128 116 124 133 134 118 126 114 127 ...
  ..$ post_bp : num [1:20] 114 98 113 99 107 116 113 111 119 117 ...
  ..$ diff_bp : num [1:20] 16 30 3 25 26 18 5 15 -5 10 ...
  ..$ post_120: logi [1:20] TRUE TRUE TRUE TRUE TRUE TRUE ...
 $ placebo  :'data.frame':  10 obs. of  5 variables:
  ..$ patient : chr [1:10] "Subject_1" "Subject_2" "Subject_3" "Subject_4" ...
  ..$ pre_bp  : num [1:10] 138 135 147 117 152 134 114 121 131 130
  ..$ post_bp : num [1:10] 105 136 123 130 134 143 135 139 120 124
  ..$ diff_bp : num [1:10] 33 -1 24 -13 18 -9 -21 -18 11 6
  ..$ post_120: logi [1:10] TRUE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE ...

title: Base R Programming
text:
Task 4: Control Flow Practice
Create a column to store status category

bp_list$treatment$status <- character(20)
bp_list$placebo$status <- character(10)

Use if/then logic to create the status column’s values
Treatment data frame:

bp_list$treatment$status <- 
  ifelse(bp_list$treatment$post_bp > 130, "high",
       ifelse(bp_list$treatment$post_bp > 120, "borderline",
              "optimal"))
bp_list$treatment$status

 [1] "optimal"    "optimal"    "optimal"    "optimal"    "optimal"   
 [6] "optimal"    "optimal"    "optimal"    "optimal"    "optimal"   
[11] "optimal"    "optimal"    "borderline" "borderline" "optimal"   
[16] "optimal"    "borderline" "optimal"    "optimal"    "optimal"   


Placebo data frame:

bp_list$placebo$status <- 
  ifelse(bp_list$placebo$post_bp > 130, "high",
       ifelse(bp_list$placebo$post_bp > 120, "borderline",
              "optimal"))
bp_list$placebo$status

 [1] "optimal"    "high"       "borderline" "borderline" "high"      
 [6] "high"       "high"       "high"       "optimal"    "borderline"

title: Base R Programming
text:
Task 5: Function Writing
Create a function to return a vector of summary statistics from treatment and placebo data frames stored within a list

summarize <- function(list, stat="mean") {
  calc <- get(stat)
  stat1 <- calc(list[[1]][[2]])
  stat2 <- calc(list[[1]][[3]])
  stat3 <- calc(list[[1]][[4]])
  stat4 <- calc(list[[2]][[2]])
  stat5 <- calc(list[[2]][[3]])
  stat6 <- calc(list[[2]][[4]])
return(c(stat1, stat2, stat3, stat4, stat5, stat6))
}

Create vectors to store desired stats and output variables names

stats_vec <- c("mean", "var", "sd", "min", "max")
names_vec <- c(paste0("txment_pre_",stats_vec[1]),
               paste0("txment_post_",stats_vec[1]),
               paste0("txment_change_",stats_vec[1]),
               paste0("plac_pre_",stats_vec[1]),
               paste0("plac_post_",stats_vec[1]),
               paste0("plac_change_",stats_vec[1]))

Create initial application of function on default “mean” statistic, assign names to resulting vector elements

result_vec <- summarize(bp_list)
names(result_vec) <- names_vec

Initialize a list and a data frame to test out two different approaches to storing the results

summary_df <- data.frame(stat = character(),
                         txment_pre = numeric(),
                         txment_post = numeric(),
                         txment_change = numeric(),
                         plac_pre = numeric(),
                         plac_post = numeric(),
                         plac_change = numeric())
summary_df[1, ] <- c(stats_vec[1], result_vec)

summary_list <- list()
summary_list[[1]] <- result_vec

Create for loop to apply summarize function across different statistics and save all output to summary_list and summary_df

for (i in 2:5){
  names_vec <- c(paste0("txment_pre_",stats_vec[i]),
               paste0("txment_post_",stats_vec[i]),
               paste0("txment_change_",stats_vec[i]),
               paste0("plac_pre_",stats_vec[i]),
               paste0("plac_post_",stats_vec[i]),
               paste0("plac_change_",stats_vec[i]))
  result_vec <- summarize(bp_list, stat=stats_vec[i])
  summary_df[i, ] <- c(stats_vec[i], result_vec)
  names(result_vec) <- names_vec
  summary_list[[i]] <- result_vec
}

View results from list and data frame

summary_df

  stat       txment_pre      txment_post    txment_change         plac_pre
1 mean           129.35           112.35               17            131.9
2  var 64.5552631578947 74.7657894736842 153.684210526316 149.877777777778
3   sd 8.03462899939348 8.64672131352018 12.3969435961577  12.242457995753
4  min              114               98               -5              114
5  max              141              130               40              152
         plac_post      plac_change
1            128.9                3
2 124.988888888889 341.333333333333
3 11.1798429724611  18.475208614068
4              105              -21
5              143               33

summary_list

[[1]]
   txment_pre_mean   txment_post_mean txment_change_mean      plac_pre_mean 
            129.35             112.35              17.00             131.90 
    plac_post_mean   plac_change_mean 
            128.90               3.00 

[[2]]
   txment_pre_var   txment_post_var txment_change_var      plac_pre_var 
         64.55526          74.76579         153.68421         149.87778 
    plac_post_var   plac_change_var 
        124.98889         341.33333 

[[3]]

        8.034629         8.646721        12.396944        12.242458 
    plac_post_sd   plac_change_sd 
       11.179843        18.475209 

[[4]]

              114                98                -5               114 
    plac_post_min   plac_change_min

              143                33
